The Local Offer

  1. Home
  2. SEND
  3. The Local Offer

The Local Offer tells you about all the support and services available for children and young people with SEND in Gloucestershire, from birth to age 25.

What the Local Offer is

Every council in England must publish a Local Offer. It is a one-stop guide to help families find information about the support available for children and young people with special educational needs and disabilities.

The Local Offer is not a service you apply for. It is a directory of what is available in your area — so you can find the right help, at the right time.

What the Local Offer includes

By law, the Local Offer must include information about:

Education

SEND support in mainstream schools, special schools, nurseries, colleges and other settings.

Health

Health services for children and young people with SEND, including speech therapy, occupational therapy and mental health support.

Social care

Social care support including short breaks, family support and help from children's social care.

Preparing for adulthood

Help with the move to adult life, including employment, independent living and further education.

Leisure and activities

Clubs, groups and activities that welcome children and young people with SEND.

Transport

Information about getting to school, college or other settings if your child has SEND.

Specialist provision in Gloucestershire

Gloucestershire has a range of specialist education settings for children and young people whose needs cannot be met in mainstream schools:

Special schools

Schools specifically designed for children with complex SEND needs. Places are named in Section I of an EHC plan.

Resourced units

Specialist units within mainstream schools that provide extra support for specific types of SEND, such as autism or hearing impairment.

Independent special schools

Approved independent schools that can be named in EHC plans. The council pays the fees if the school is named in the plan.

Alternative provision

Education outside mainstream school for children who cannot attend, including pupil referral units, hospital education and home tuition.

Help us improve the Local Offer

The council must involve children, young people and families when reviewing and updating the Local Offer. Your experience matters.

If you have found something missing or have suggestions for how the Local Offer could be improved, please use the feedback form at the bottom of this page or contact us directly.

Your legal right

The Local Offer is a legal requirement under Section 30 of the Children and Families Act 2014. The council must publish it and keep it up to date.

Need help finding services?

SENDIASS

Free advice on finding the right support.
